```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
```

```{r load packages}

library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)
library(igraph)

```

```{r load data}

main_data <- read_csv("data_ready.csv")
distance_data <- read_csv("output_df.csv")

```

## Data

```{r summary data}

n_infants <- main_data %>% group_by(Subject, Language) %>% tally()
n_langs <- main_data %>% group_by(Language) %>% tally()
age_data <- main_data %>% summarise(mean_age = mean(Age),
                                     min_age = min(Age),
                                     max_age = max(Age),
                                     sd_age = sd(Age))

tokens_data <- n_infants %>% ungroup() %>% summarise(mean_tok = mean(n),
                                       min_tok = min(n),
                                       max_tok = max(n),
                                       sd_tok = sd(n))

types_data <- main_data %>% group_by(Subject, Gloss) %>% tally() %>%
  ungroup() %>%
  group_by(Subject) %>% tally() %>% summarise(mean_typ = mean(n),
                                       min_typ = min(n),
                                       max_typ = max(n),
                                       sd_typ = sd(n))
```


```{r ex of distance table}

checks <- distance_data %>% dplyr::select(Gloss, IPAactual, 
                                S1C1.S1C1, S1C2.S1C2, S1C3.S1C3, S1C4.S1C4,
                                S2C1.S2C1, S2C2.S2C2, S2C3.S2C3, S2C4.S2C4,
                                SFC1.SFC1, SFC2.SFC2, 
                                SFCF1.SFCF1, SFCF2.SFCF2,
                                nsyl_actual) %>%
  filter(S1C1.S1C1 != "0" &
           nsyl_actual ==2) %>%
  group_by(Gloss) %>%
  slice(1)

### need to go through and check all S2s as they are not in SF position - SFCFs are showing up in SFC1 position
```


```{r cars}
summary(cars)
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
